definitions.meaning: 愿意给予或分享，表现出对他人的慷慨
definitions.usage: 描述一个人在金钱、时间或资源上乐于给予他人，通常带有无私或仁慈的含义。

examples.scene: 在一个社区活动中，志愿者们正在为当地的慈善机构筹款。每个人都带来了食物、衣物或现金来支持这个活动。
examples.chineseIdea: 一个人主动拿出自己的钱来帮助需要的人，表现出一种无私的品质。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: She decided to @ @ @ to the charity event to support the local shelter.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: She decided to 「make a donation」 to the charity event to support the local shelter.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她决定为慈善活动「捐款」以支持当地的庇护所。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：She give money to charity. 纠正：She made a donation to the charity.

examples.scene: 在一个工作场所，团队成员因项目截止日期临近而感到压力很大。一位同事主动提出加班来协助完成任务。
examples.chineseIdea: 一个人愿意花自己的时间来帮助同事完成工作，体现出团队精神。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: He always @ @ to his teammates when they’re overwhelmed with work.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: He always 「offers help」 to his teammates when they’re overwhelmed with work.
examples.chineseTranslation: 他总是在队友工作不堪重负时「提供帮助」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：He give help to his team. 纠正：He offers help to his team.

definitions.meaning: 数量或程度很大，超出预期
definitions.usage: 描述某事物（如食物、奖励或空间）在数量或规模上非常充足，甚至超过正常或预期。

examples.scene: 在一家餐馆，服务员端上来一大盘食物，顾客惊讶于食物的分量远远超过他们的预期。
examples.chineseIdea: 食物分量很大，让人觉得物超所值。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The restaurant served a @ @ of pasta that was more than enough for two people.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The restaurant served a 「large portion」 of pasta that was more than enough for two people.
examples.chineseTranslation: 这家餐厅提供了一「大份」意大利面，足够两个人吃。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The restaurant give big food. 纠正：The restaurant served a large portion of food.

examples.scene: 一个家庭搬进了一栋新房子，发现客厅的空间非常宽敞，可以容纳很多家具和活动。
examples.chineseIdea: 房子的空间很大，给人一种舒适和自由的感觉。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The new apartment has @ @ for a big sofa and a dining table.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The new apartment has 「ample space」 for a big sofa and a dining table.
examples.chineseTranslation: 新公寓有「充足的空间」放置一个大沙发和餐桌。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The apartment has big space. 纠正：The apartment has ample space.

definitions.usage: 描述一个人在评价他人或处理事情时表现出宽容、仁慈或不苛求的态度。

examples.scene: 在一个课堂上，学生因误解题目而答错了问题，老师没有批评，而是鼓励他继续尝试。
examples.chineseIdea: 老师对学生的错误表现出理解和鼓励，而不是责骂。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The teacher used @ @ to encourage the student despite his mistake.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The teacher used 「kind words」 to encourage the student despite his mistake.
examples.chineseTranslation: 老师用「善意的语言」鼓励学生，尽管他犯了错误。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The teacher say good words to student. 纠正：The teacher used kind words to encourage the student.

examples.scene: 在一次家庭聚会上，孩子不小心打翻了饮料，父母没有生气，而是温和地处理了这件事。
examples.chineseIdea: 父母对孩子的过失表现出宽容，体现出仁慈的态度。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Her parents took a @ @ when she spilled juice on the table.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Her parents took a 「lenient approach」 when she spilled juice on the table.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她的父母在她把果汁洒在桌上时采取了「宽容的态度」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：Her parents not angry when she spill juice. 纠正：Her parents took a lenient approach when she spilled juice.
